intro: Koanophyllon revealii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has small, green, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with deep root systems and reduced leaf surface area to minimize water loss. Koanophyllon revealii is often found in rocky soils and is an important part of the local ecosystem.
